intro: Mariscus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth mariscus, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Mariscus laevigatus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
